summary: The SAFE HOME Act proposes a refundable tax credit for individuals who make qualified wildfire mitigation expenditures on their primary residences. The credit equals 25% of the expenditure, capped at $25,000, with a phaseout based on adjusted gross income.  Eligible expenditures include fire-resistant roof improvements, ignition-resistant construction materials, fire buffers, and smoke inhalation prevention. The bill defines "qualified dwelling unit" and includes documentation and termination provisions. The provisions take effect in 2025.
